author: nflaig
content: Last call on https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/pull/568, otherwise will be merging that EOD

author: inspector.butters
content:
one question: 
engine api for `engine_getClientVersionV1` mentions that:

> When connected to multiple execution clients via a multiplexer, the multiplexer MUST concatenate the responses from each execution client into a single, flat array before returning the response to the consensus client.`

in this case, which one should `getNodeVersionV2()` return in the `execution_client` field? 
cc <@884836500037066862>

author: nflaig
content:
not sure that's a common production scenario, for example in case of the graffiti info in lodestar we just pick the first entry in the array and we currently only cache the first entry meaning that's what we would return from the api

I am not sure if other CLs actually make use of more than one entry there, we could just change the `execution_client` field type to be a `oneOf` and allow to return either client info or array of client info

but it might be worth addressing just to mirror the engine api format more closely, don't think it's useful for the motivation of the PR though

cc <@737740104281489531>

author: jameshe5018
content: good call out didn't think of that but also not sure if we are doing that correctly right now anyways...
